headline.main: URUGUAY TIED TO GRAZING; Economy Is Geared to Sheep, Cattle and Their Products

docs.snippet: FROM the time I was a child studying geography it has been my main ambition in life to see the countries that made different colors on the map. The first vacation I ever had outside the United States came during the war.
docs.lead_paragraph: FROM the time I was a child studying geography it has been my main ambition in life to see the countries that made different colors on the map. The first vacation I ever had outside the United States came during the war.

headline.main: HOW A WORKING GIRL SATISFIES HER WANDERLUST

docs.snippet: THE year which ended last Monday brought more than 2,500 new major and minor varieties of postal paper. The figure recorded in New York last week was 2,495 but other stamps which must be added to this total appeared during the final week of 1951.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE year which ended last Monday brought more than 2,500 new major and minor varieties of postal paper. The figure recorded in New York last week was 2,495 but other stamps which must be added to this total appeared during the final week of 1951.
docs.abstract: Hashemite Jordan: King Abdullah and 2 other items overprinted 'Fil's'

headline.main: NEWS OF THE WORLD OF STAMPS; More Than 2,500 Varieties Were Issued in 1951 by 158 Countries

docs.snippet: Your editorial of Dec. 18 on Uruguay's "Experiment in Democracy," admirably pays respect to one of the few democratic peoples left among us. It is a bold step that Uruguayans have taken, and we can only hope that their determination to be ruled...
docs.lead_paragraph: Your editorial of Dec. 18 on Uruguay's "Experiment in Democracy," admirably pays respect to one of the few democratic peoples left among us. It is a bold step that Uruguayans have taken, and we can only hope that their determination to be ruled democratically is rewarded by success, although we must recognize that we have no assurance that such will be the case.

docs.snippet: British sterling and the Canadian dollar vied with each other in the foreign exchange market last week. Stimulated by a heavy turn-over in active trading, pound sterling staged a sharp rebound from its earlier irregularity, and the Canadian dollar...
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling and the Canadian dollar vied with each other in the foreign exchange market last week. Stimulated by a heavy turn-over in active trading, pound sterling staged a sharp rebound from its earlier irregularity, and the Canadian dollar continued to roll along on the strong buying which has marked its course over the last month.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Jan. 4, 1952

docs.snippet: December linage in seven New York daily newspapers was 3.44 per cent below the same month a year ago, according to figures made available yesterday. The total for the month was 13,328,123 lines. Automotive showed the most serious loss at 31.73 per...
docs.lead_paragraph: December linage in seven New York daily newspapers was 3.44 per cent below the same month a year ago, according to figures made available yesterday. The total for the month was 13,328,123 lines. Automotive showed the most serious loss at 31.73 per cent less than a year ago.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 12 -- The United Nations General Assembly ordered today the formulation this year of a plan for collection and administration of a largo international fund for economic development of backward areas.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Jan. 12 -- The United Nations General Assembly ordered today the formulation this year of a plan for collection and administration of a largo international fund for economic development of backward areas.
docs.abstract: Assembly adopts resolution urging govts to adm recommended programs
